is+aimed+at+enticing+another+generation+of+younger+gay+men-+in+whom+new+HIV+infections+are+already+running+rampant-+into+seeing+things+his+way.+The+most+remarkable+aspect+of+this+is+the+effort+he+has+taken+to+make+the+program+look+like+an+official+program+of+the+University+of+California+at+Berkeley%2C+right+down+to+the+use+of+the+University+Seal.+It+also+features+his+1986+appointment+to+the+NAS.+It+most+certainly+is+not+a+university+function.+Moreover%2C+the+entire+text+of+the+ad+is+deceptive%2C+disguised+to+look+like+an+ad+for+one+of+the+many+community+forums+held+about+the+new+therapies%2C+research+advances%2C+and+viral+load.+There+isn%27t+a+hint+anywhere+as+to+what+the+real+agenda+is%2C+or+how+he+will+do+his+best+to+discourage+the+use+of+the+new+drugs+and+diagnostic+measures+which+have+given+so+much+hope+and+new+life+to+so+many+people.+He+will+be+there+to+try+to+convince+an+unwitting+and+otherwise+uninformed+audience+that+there+is+serious+scientific+support+for+his+contrarian+view+and+that+all+those+who+hold+other+views+are+somehow+puppets+of+the+pharmaceutical+industry+and+a+conspiratorial+research+establishment.+Undoubtedly%2C+he+will+succeed+with+some+of+those+present%2C+and+no+doubt+hasten+their+deaths.+In+these+days+when+AIDS+therapy+has+shown+such+great+promise%2C+it+is+difficult+to+distinguish+his+actions+from+those+of+a+mass+murderer.%0A%0AI+am+writing+to+you+as+the+chief+executive+of+the+National+Academy+of+Sciences+because+Professor+Duesberg+is+a+member+of+your+distinguished+body%2C+whose+mission+is+to+serve+the+public+interest.+His+actions%2C+I+believe%2C+are+an+affront+to+everything+the+NAS+stands+for.+They+mock+your+Academy%27s+commitment+to+the+scientific+method+and+to+the+principle+that+scientists+should+fight+their+battles+in+a+peer+setting%2C+not+by+public+relation+efforts+in+the+public.+As+members+of+the+public+aggrieved+by+his+actions%2C+we+call+upon+the+National+Academy+of+Sciences+to+raise+the+question+of+whether+he+is+fit+for+continued+membe His \"Medical Hypotheses<wbr></wbr>\" is not the first example. In other articles, for example his 2003 review in the \"Journal of Bioscience<wbr></wbr>,\" he makes very questionab<wbr></wbr>le statements about the work of other scientists<wbr></wbr>, statements some would consider outright misreprese<wbr></wbr>ntation. On the side, Duesberg has made it his business to advise individual HIV-positi<wbr></wbr>ve people to avoid medical treatment. The late Christine Maggiore sought out Duesberg\'s advice before becoming an AIDS denialist activist..<wbr></wbr>.and foregoing treatment, including during pregnancy. She passed the infection to her daughter; both are now dead. Also dead are hundreds of thousands in South Africa, who were denied antiretrov<wbr></wbr>irals under the regime of Thabo Mbeki. He began to question HIV as the cause of AIDS after reading Duesberg\'s website, and he invited Duesberg to advise him on AIDS policy. The victims of this scientific irresponsi<wbr></wbr>bility, sadly, never received a letter of reprimand, and they were dismissed from this life, not from a comfortabl<wbr></wbr>e academic position." });

Response
JSReplyMSGId('jst-1', 'jsid-1271889631-431', { "TS": 1271889631, "Text": "I showed in Florida Scientist Vol 68, #3 (2005) (see my website for a copy) that there is a very simple way of determinin<wbr></wbr>g from the PDG data tables that the proper mass of the up quark which occurs in the simpler baryons such as protons and neutrons is 1.914 MeV (rounded) with the similarly identified down quark at 5.11 MeV.  These masses are toward the lower ends of the PDG uncertaint<wbr></wbr>ies.  But this cannot account alone for the stair-step of masses in the N particle Series for instance, or any other of the baryon series.  These series arise because each quark also has a less basic (but precise) alternate mass toward the upper end of the PDG uncertaint<wbr></wbr>ies, not an isomer.  And these higher masses arise one at a time in place of the lower ones, with the heaviest N particle having only the higher masses at the top step of the stairs.  All are covered by a simple power/expo<wbr></wbr>nential law derived from the PDG tables.  At each step of the N or Delta, etc., series of heavier quark substituti<wbr></wbr>on options there is a group of the particles with a lightest group leader and typically two isomers of slightly greater mass.  All very systematic<wbr></wbr>, and without having to rely on an infinity of virtuals.-<wbr></wbr>---- It will be interestin<wbr></wbr>g to see what account the PDG takes of the Davies group\'s new calculatio<wbr></wbr>ns" });

Request sent: http://js-kit.com/comment.put?js-CmtName=EP&js-CmtParentID=jsid-1271889471-618&js-CmtEmail=epietrowicz%40gmail.com&tid=jst-1&ref=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.sciencemag.org%2Fsciencenow%2F2010%2F04%2Fdoes-our-universe-live-inside-a-.html&js-CmtText=Yes%2C+but+mathematical+law+does+not+translate+to+physical+law.+It+depends+on+what+is+meant+by+%22proven%22.+Tenets+of+pure+mathematics+can+be+proven+because+they+are+absolutes-+mathematical+law-+but+these+can+only+model+the+real+world%2C+not+define+it.+Using+your+example%2C+thermodynamics+cannot+be+mathematically+proven%2C+only+modeled%2C+because+it+is+a+physical+principle.+The+closest+you+can+get+to+scientific+%22proof%22+is+through+experimentation%2C+but+even+then+it+cannot+be+verified+under+all+possible+circumstances%2C+so+it+remains+a+physical+model+%28albeit+a+very+good+one%29%2C+not+a+true+physical+law.+It%27s+great+when+pure+math+and+real+data+tightly+agree+as+it+suggests+the+mathematical+model+is+accurate-+quantum+mechanics+has+done+very+well+in+this+regard.+But+a+mathematically-based+idea+is+not+particularly+useful+in+the+physical+world+until+it+has+an+experimental+or+at+least+observational+basis.+That+is+why+some+things+like+string+theory+or+faster-than-light+theories+do+not+at+present+fulfill+the+definition+of+theory-+they+are+mathematical+models+only+but+without+direct+physical+evidence%2C+so+they+aren%27t+yet%2C+as+you+said%2C+%22functional%22+models-+they+are+indeed+mathematical+hypotheses+about+the+physical+world.+Which+gets+to+my+original+point-+calling+every+new+idea+in+physics+that+is+so+far+based+only+on+calculation+%28including+this+one%29+a+scientific+%22theory%22+is+not+only+misleading%2C+but+feeds+the+misunderstandings+about+the+meaning+of+the+term+among+the+general+public-+i.e.+%22it%27s+only+a+theory%22.
Response
JSReplyMSGId('jst-1', 'jsid-1271889671-760', { "TS": 1271889671, "Text": "Yes, but mathematic<wbr></wbr>al law does not translate to physical law. It depends on what is meant by \"proven\". Tenets of pure mathematic<wbr></wbr>s can be proven because they are absolutes- mathematic<wbr></wbr>al law- but these can only model the real world, not define it. Using your example, thermodyna<wbr></wbr>mics cannot be mathematic<wbr></wbr>ally proven, only modeled, because it is a physical principle. The closest you can get to scientific \"proof\" is through experiment<wbr></wbr>ation, but even then it cannot be verified under all possible circumstan<wbr></wbr>ces, so it remains a physical model (albeit a very good one), not a true physical law. It\'s great when pure math and real data tightly agree as it suggests the mathematic<wbr></wbr>al model is accurate- quantum mechanics has done very well in this regard. But a mathematic<wbr></wbr>ally-based idea is not particular<wbr></wbr>ly useful in the physical world until it has an experiment<wbr></wbr>al or at least observatio<wbr></wbr>nal basis. That is why some things like string theory or faster-tha<wbr></wbr>n-light theories do not at present fulfill the definition of theory- they are mathematic<wbr></wbr>al models only but without direct physical evidence, so they aren\'t yet, as you said, \"functiona<wbr></wbr>l\" models- they are indeed mathematic<wbr></wbr>al hypotheses about the physical world. Which gets to my original point- calling every new idea in physics that is so far based only on calculatio<wbr></wbr>n (including this one) a scientific \"theory\" is not only misleading<wbr></wbr>, but feeds the misunderst<wbr></wbr>andings about the meaning of the term among the general public- i.e. \"it\'s only a theory\"." });

Posted in http://news.sciencemag.org/sciencenow/2010/04/does-our-universe-live-inside-a-.html

You have numerous government<wbr></wbr>s, celebritie<wbr></wbr>s, commercial enterprise<wbr></wbr>s and millions of people around the world supporting and defending your beliefs. Compared to this arsenal, our numbers are microscopi<wbr></wbr>c. Our financial resources amount to only thousands of dollars spread over twenty years. In spite of astonishin<wbr></wbr>gly meager resources we continue to do our jobs as scientists<wbr></wbr>--and this upsets you no end.\r\n\r\nSo, what is behind your obvious hatred of us as individual<wbr></wbr>s? How do we threaten you? Do you take some kind of pleasure in vitriolic attacks? Or is it simple sport for entertainm<wbr></wbr>ent sake, knowing you are completely safe from rebuke and censure from above?\r\n\r\nYou say we are responsibl<wbr></wbr>e for the deaths of hundreds of thousands, perhaps millions of people. JSReplyMSGId('jst-1', 'jsid-1271889734-231', { "TS": 1271889734, "Text": "I would bet my last dollar that every galaxy has a super massive black hole in its center, also that every globular cluster has an intermedia<wbr></wbr>te black hole in its center.  This seems to be an essential part of galactic evolution. First came the super massive stars, then about one through ten million years latter came the black holes, then the merger of black holes followed by a large collection of hydrogen and helium by gravationa<wbr></wbr>l attraction .As a result, the birth of a galaxy complete with material for new stars. Some galaxies create new stars like burnning a candle at both ends, using most of the available hydrogen not leaving enough for additional star formation. There are many reasons for this including ; merging or passing galaxies causing shock waves that causes congealmen<wbr></wbr>t of nebulae thus a baby boom.  Stars born in one era will grow old and ten billion years latter will remain the only stars in the galaxy. This is caused mostly by an out side gravatatio<wbr></wbr>nal attraction (another galaxie) , causing super nova, gravationa<wbr></wbr>l collapse of nebulae triggering star formation,  and sweeping raw, unbound material from the galaxy leaving no raw material for new stars.\r\n\r\nIf a feeding super massive black hole emitting hard x -rays can halt new star formation, it certanly is not the only way it can be done.  It is my guess that the massive galaxies in these studies were old elipitical galaxies which has already gone through many collisions in the  past as do all galaxies. This may be the real correlatio<wbr></wbr>n.\r\nQuasars likely,are not considered in this study because of the great distances involved, not being able to resolve the stars. JSReplyMSGId('jst-1', 'jsid-1271889736-373', { "TS": 1271889736, "Text": "Kati,\n\nOne is allowed to change what happened in the past ONLY if it would not affect other decisions that have already been made.\n\nIn the case of this experiment<wbr></wbr>, nothing depends on if the photons behave like a particle or a wave. But you can not change your decision (for example) to call in sick to work. Your boss, your co workers, your cell phone company\'s current existence all depend on what you did earlier. So changing that decision would actually change their past also.\n\nSpecial concern it taken such that these light particle\'s history does not affect other histories in the universe. THEN, we are allowed to change the light particles history at will.\n\nHope this helps," });

JSReplyMSGId('jst-1', 'jsid-1271889764-944', { "TS": 1271889764, "Text": "Pardon me for jumping in here, but I must. \"Theory\" is one of the most misused words in the language -- including by scientists -- to the point where even the dictionari<wbr></wbr>es are having to adjust. The word you mean to use is \"hypothesi<wbr></wbr>s.\" It is indeed an educated guess. Theory, as in Theory of Evolution or Theory of Relativity<wbr></wbr>, is a set of scientific principles developed through reasoned calculatio<wbr></wbr>n and experiment<wbr></wbr>ation that has withstood all challenges and remains valid -- until it can be disproven. " });

The models depend on the secondary effects of water vapor to reach their alarmist temperatur<wbr></wbr>e increase conclusion<wbr></wbr>s.  \n\nCO2 also has a logarithmi<wbr></wbr>c contributi<wbr></wbr>on to temperatur<wbr></wbr>e--meaning that it\'s contributi<wbr></wbr>on to the greenhouse effect is largest in the lower end of its addition to the atmosphere (the great majority of heating from CO2 is already in play). Anything can be a black hole.  If you could compress the earth to about the size of a sugar cube, it would  become a black hole.  The event horizon is that size, the size where an object becomes a black hole." });

The drug was widely used by college students and age-peers in the 1960s and 1970s in North America, of course. But its use is a significan<wbr></wbr>t part of oral and writen histories of various Native American tribes and/or enclaves, with echoes reaching back to Asian and African cultures, as well. The ingestion of psilocybin was often a part of religious ceremonies and was chronicled with an unfortunat<wbr></wbr>e mixture of truth and imaginativ<wbr></wbr>e fiction in the cult-like books of a writer with the pseudonym Carlos Castenadas<wbr></wbr>, in his \"Don Juan\" stories of Hopi Indian practices. \r\n\r\nThe myths surroundin<wbr></wbr>g psilocybin have reached absurd levels in some cases. Response
JSReplyMSGId('jst-1', 'jsid-1271889790-65', { "TS": 1271889790, "Text": "Black holes don\'t exist, because it takes forever for a star to collapse to a point with zero volume and infinite density from our point of view as external observers. It\'s nice math from the point of view of the star itself, but it\'s not the reality in our frame of reference. The simple fact is that General Relativity breaks down in black holes. Singularit<wbr></wbr>y, i.e. an arbitary mass in a zero volume is nonsense. Forever lasting collapse into a black hole or matter forever approachin<wbr></wbr>g the event horizon as viewed by external observers is nonsense. Hawking has combined quantum mechanics with GR, while they do not agree at all. GR does not apply on small scale where QM applies, while QM does not apply on large scale where GR applies." });

Response
JSReplyMSGId('jst-1', 'jsid-1271889791-353', { "TS": 1271889791, "Text": "Most parasites have very complex life cyles, and intestinal worms do not spend their entire life in an intestine.  The example that comes to mind for me is Ascaris, which is quite possibly the most well researched nematode on earth.  The adult worms do live in the intestine, and they are  anaerobes, but they still have mitochondr<wbr></wbr>ia, and their embryos must have molecular oxygen to grow and develop.  The fertilized eggs need time outside of the body to develop and become infectious<wbr></wbr>.  They hatch after a host has swallowed the and the Juveniles need so much oxygen, that they migrate from the intestines through the circulator<wbr></wbr>y sytem and into the lungs where they grow.  When they are mature they migrate out of the lungs and into the mouth where they can then get swallowed.  Once they are back in the intestines<wbr></wbr>, they can be anaerobic again.   \r\nWith all of that said, you should see in the article that it noted finding various stages of the Loricifera life cycle in the anaerobic environmen<wbr></wbr>t.  Which suggested that it can spend it\'s entire life without O2.  That is a key difference<wbr></wbr>." });
